info: Built between 1860-1861, the Fishermen's Hall hosted a variety of activities over the centuries, including exhibitions, dances, and theatrical productions. At one point it was even used as a church.

This location marks the site of the City Stove Establishment, owned by Robert Peace & Co., makers of stoves and tinware. The company ran an advertisement that appeared in the Morning Chronicle of September 2nd, 1865.

This location marks the approximate site of Jersey Cottage, a rural property outside of the downtown core of St. John's. An advertisement for the sale of this property ran in the Morning Chronicle of August 30th, 1865.
This location marks the residence of a Miss Mary Tillman, who ran an advertisement for tutoring in French and Music in the Morning Chronicle of September 2nd, 1865.
